How do you think of your music it's so cool

      this may sound weird, but, .....it thinks of me

      like a reflection of you, but not a reflection. actual

      you can't. but if you are asking this question you have already indicated that the will is there

      an even more fragile box

12.26.20  2:06 am   how are you so smart?

      ah, that's from the huge amount of books on the shelf behind me in the video chat

12.26.20  12:16 am   a song you posted 2 years ago is titled "christmas isn't real" does that still hold up or has christmas become real

      it is real, despite its best efforts to be fake

12.26.20  12:09 am   do you ever write something and, when you look back, it has a meaning that you weren't even thinking about in the moment?

      yes

12.26.20  12:06 am   Do you find albums overwhelming

      i usually find them underwhelming. which is kind of a paradox because i think the reason they seem underwhelming is because it's too many new songs at the same time

12.25.20  11:50 pm   Hello Bill. I was wondering if you'd ever considering making a holiday song.

      sure. i've done it before, and i will also do it more times

12.25.20  10:35 pm   how do i turn thoughtlings into thoughts and ideas

      start by writing them down. that might be all it takes

12.25.20  9:38 pm   How did you predict 2020 in "just did a bad thing"? "All the things I'm supposed to do / and the places I'm supposed to go are cancelled"

      things predict themselves. that's what i like about songwriting, it opens the door for things to do what they're gonna do

     What is the real meaning behind this line?

     here's what i think, as i'm analyzing it now: this is a classic case of the song being about itself. The starting point for that song was just the one line ('just did a bad thing'), with really no indication of any sort of form or anything. Half way through the first section, it already seems to ditch out of the original paradigm slightly ('wondering what it is, etc'), it slips into the major key, and just,... no sort of repeating figure has been established. so far everything seems to be a special-case scenario. Then when it hits the next stanza, (bad day, bad year), we've already broken from what it had done in the first stanza. (the first stanza had the 'regret' line, which is quite different from the first line, but in the second stanza, the first two lines essentially are the same as each other), so for many reasons, at this point, (after 'bad year'), it's very clear that there is NO established pattern. we are free to roam. And it's likely at this point that i was feeling stuck, because really there's just too many possibilities. I was probably running through what i had so far, thinking i would get clues about the future (of the song) from the past (in the song). And that's just not gonna happen, because really what should probably happen is it should probably get out and GO somewhere it hasn't gone yet. So, looking at what did come next, the 'cancelled' line, this is a perfect way of expressing that everything you might have expected was going to happen (based on what happened so far) in the song, will probably not happen. And, sure enough, immediately after this, it transitions into a totally new key, and a new paradigm entirely. So basically the reason for that line is to shake off the previous paradigm (bad things, etc), because we gotta get away and jump into a whole new territory. (the 'game' section, etc).
     As far as anything having resemblence to future world events, well, this is always more likely to happen the more songs i write. when making a case that something predicted something, you can always ignore the ones that didn't fit. such as 'at the airport terminal' which certainly does not predict 2020

12.25.20  8:31 pm   I often hear melodies In my head but I can't transcribe them. Any tips for transcribing better? 

      you might not need to, if you can record yourself singing it into your phone or something similar

      use melody. and if that's not working, you can take it a step further and use words to make the melody

12.24.20  10:09 pm   Hey bill, i love your music, and you've inspired me a lot. But the thing is i get so much inspiration from music that i want to replicate the feelings i get when i listen to it. But i am more experienced in visual art and would prefer to work with it. Long question short do you think it's possible for visual art (paintings, drawings, sculptures, etc) to somewhat encapsulate the feelings in written art or musical art (and vice versa)?

      yes
